public static org.w3c.dom.Document getDocument(java.net.URL url)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                               java.io.IOException
Parse an XML document. Equivalent to getDocument(url, null).

Parameters:
url - the url of the document to parse.
Returns:
a parsed document tree.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied url is null.
java.io.IOException - if an IO exception or parse error occurs with the URL.

                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                               java.io.IOException
Parse an XML document using a given resolver for DTDs.

Parameters:
url - the url of the document to parse.
resolver - the entity resolver to use. If null, no specific resolver is used.
Returns:
a parsed document tree.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied url is null.
java.io.IOException - if an IO exception occurs with the URL.

getElementsByTagName

public static java.util.List getElementsByTagName(org.w3c.dom.Element parent,
                                                  java.lang.String tagName)
                                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Get all the descendent element nodes of a given parent node where the name of each descendent node is that given by the specified tag name. Note that only direct child nodes are examined.

Parameters:
parent - the parent element node containing the descendants.
tagName - the name of the tag to retrieve elements for.
Returns:
a set of org.w3c.dom.Element objects, where each object in the set corresponds to an element node of the parent node whose tag name is that specified by tagName
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either of the supplied parameters is null, or tagName is zero-length..

getUniqueElement

public static org.w3c.dom.Element getUniqueElement(org.w3c.dom.Element parent,
                                                   java.lang.String tagName)
                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                   XMLException
Get a unique descendant element node from a given parent node. The descendant element is expected to occur once and only once.

Parameters:
parent - the parent element node containing the descendant.
tagName - the name of the tag to retrieve elements for.
Returns:
the descendant element noe.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either of the supplied parameters is null, or tagName is zero-length..
XMLException - if zero or more than one descendant element with the given name is found.

getOptionalElement

public static org.w3c.dom.Element getOptionalElement(org.w3c.dom.Element parent,
                                                     java.lang.String tagName)
                                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                     XMLException
Get an optional descendant element node from a given parent node. The descendant may occur at most one time.

Parameters:
parent - the parent element containing the descendant.
tagName - the name of the tag to retrieve elements for.
Returns:
the descendant element, or null if no descendant was found.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either of the supplied parameters is null, or tagName is zero-length..
XMLException - if more than one element was found.

getElementContent

public static java.lang.String getElementContent(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                 XMLException
Get the contents of an text element. A text element contains a string of text only, not further XML tags.

Parameters:
element - the text element.
Returns:
the text contents of the element as a string. Whitespace from both ends of the string is trimmed.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the element is null
XMLException - if the element is not a text node.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

getTextElement

                                              java.lang.String name)
                                       throws XMLException
Get the contents of a text element that is a child of another node.

Parameters:
parent - the parent element of the text element
tagName - the tag name of the text element
Returns:
the text contents of the element as a string. Whitespace from both ends of the string is trimmed.
Throws:
XMLException - if the element is not found, or is not a text node

createTextElement

public static void createTextElement(org.w3c.dom.Element parent,
                                     java.lang.String tagName,
                                     java.lang.String text)
Create a new tag as a child of an existing element. Fill the tag with the given text string.

Parameters:
parent - the parent element to create the tag as a child of
tagName - the tag name of the child to create
text - the text content to give the newly created tag

mergeDocuments

public static void mergeDocuments(org.w3c.dom.Document toModify,
                                  org.w3c.dom.Document toMerge,
                                  java.lang.String[] tagsToMerge)
                           throws XMLException
Merge two documents. Elements from the toMerge document are copied into the toModify document. Elements with the special attribute 'id' are matched between documents based on the value of the attribute (which is expected to be unique across all instances in a document -- i.e. it is an XML ID attribute).

For example, if this is the toModify document: 

 <doc1>
   <tag1> abc </tag1>
   <tag2 id="123"> 
     <tag3> def </tag3>
   </tag2>
 </doc1>
.. and this is the toMerge document: 
 <doc2>
   <new-tag> ghi </new-tag>
   <tag2 id="123">
     <new-tag-2> jkl </new-tag-2>
   </tag2>
 </doc2>
.. then toModify will become: 
 <doc1>
   <tag1> abc </tag1>
   <tag2 id="123"> 
     <tag3> def </tag3>
     <new-tag-2> jkl </new-tag-2>
   </tag2>
   <new-tag> ghi </new-tag>
 </doc1>

Parameters:
toModify - the document to merge data into
toMerge - the document to merge data from
tagsToMerge - a non-null array of tags where collisions should be merged
Throws:
XMLException - if an ID was found in toMerge that could not be matched up with toModify

mergeDocuments

public static void mergeDocuments(org.w3c.dom.Document toModify,
                                  org.w3c.dom.Document toMerge)
                           throws XMLException
As mergeDocuments(Document,Document,String[]), but no collisions are merged

Parameters:
toModify - the document to merge data into
toMerge - the document to merge data from
Throws:
XMLException
